body: I am not sure if the issue that you are facing is related to specularity or exposure....here is what happens if you change the exposure on a Radiance image. e = 0 [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/AgFOgF-tqnRlFVcM2A9WvOXxYoOpGiKOJuq-GZkU2jX3h6UxY5f07hOUaeWLmjt7z4c37SP64-3KCQkQ92aoK*PxLMo69Kz-/0.bmp) e= -1 [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/AgFOgF-tqnTDtl1KPC7kOVdIwZ1ZHFuRDglrbJZCWMYRwBDgix3G-XZkpSvwRs1iT46DBpeINIk348pvl3A-F-shMkgvFoFC/1.bmp)e=-2 [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/AgFOgF-tqnQRd-qkRYHkYr3yijEuE52dZceFH7ng6gp6eNVkQfFQl5sUMMklWjuYnV3tPFC8YS2jl76NMYKqsOSlZn*mmWYt/2.bmp) e= -3 [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/AgFOgF-tqnTJdRb*jE1XmfIy9W4M-Uyur7Op7LQhtXjtIBZkWchHrjVskZdALxpwExwkkqra9pyRPttrRXpJ5u0Yffm3WUMO/3.bmp) e = -4 [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/AgFOgF-tqnS-z0FfY4Ad6L3znLmi8GDL6txsQIQBy6ztfrEk21Hk3zD1Qs0-dCLoSKdb6tyiKzb*qNAM2TZomvYJCeoBOtqM/4.bmp) Setting exposure values is a "post-processing" thing done to improve the display of the image on a device or photograph. So, your analysis will still be physically based. I think towards the end of his video Mostapha talks about how the exposure values can be set through Honeybee....
